original: Atha kho vaḍḍho licchavī yena mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho vaḍḍhaḥ licchavī yena mettiya bhūmajakāḥ bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā mettiya bhūmajake bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: He went to them and said,

analyzed: vandāmi ayyā ati  evam vutte mettiyabhūmajakāḥ bhikkhū na alapisu
translated: “I pay homage, Venerables.”🔽But the monks from Mettiyā did not respond.🔽A second time Vaḍḍha said the same thing,

original: Dutiyampi kho vaḍḍho licchavī mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—🔽“vandāmi, ayyā”ti.
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho vaḍḍhaḥ licchavī mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etat avoca 🔽vandāmi ayyā ati
translated: but again the monks from Mettiyā did not respond.

analyzed: dutiyam pi kho mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū na alapisu
translated: The monks from the Mettiya and Bhūmajaka clans didn’t respond.

original: Tatiyampi kho vaḍḍho licchavī mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho vaḍḍhaḥ licchavī mettiyabhūmajake bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: For a third time Vaḍḍha said to them,
“I pay respect, Venerables.”

analyzed: tatiyam pi kho mettiyabhūmajakāḥ bhikkhū na alapisu
translated: Again they didn’t respond.

original: “Kyāhaṁ ayyānaṁ aparajjhāmi, kissa maṁ ayyā nālapantī”ti?
analyzed: kyā aham ayyānam aparajjhāmi kissa mama ayyāḥ na alapanti iti
translated: “What have I done wrong that you don’t respond to me?”

original: “Tathā hi pana tvaṁ, āvuso vaḍḍha, amhe dabbena mallaputtena viheṭhiyamāne ajjhupekkhasī”ti.
analyzed: tathā hi pana tva āvuso vaḍḍha amhe dabbena mallaputtena viheṭhiyamāne ajjhupekkhasi iti
translated: “It’s because you ignored us when Dabba the Mallian was harassing us.”
“What can I do?”

original: “Sace kho tvaṁ, āvuso vaḍḍha, iccheyyāsi, ajjeva bhagavā āyasmantaṁ dabbaṁ mallaputtaṁ nāsāpeyyā”ti.
analyzed: sace kho tvam āvuso vaḍḍhaḥ iccheyyāsi ajja iva bhagavā āyasmantam dabbam malla puttam nāsāpeyya ati
translated: “If you wish, Venerable Vaḍḍha, you could have the Buddha expel Dabba the Mallian today.”

original: “Kyāhaṁ, ayyā, karomi, kiṁ mayā sakkā kātun”ti?
analyzed: kyā āha ayyā karomi kim mayā sakkā kātunti
translated: “What can I do? What can I do?”

original: “Ehi tvaṁ, āvuso vaḍḍha, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ evaṁ vadehi—
analyzed: ehi tvai āvuso vaḍḍha yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam evam vadehi
translated: “Come, Vaḍḍha, go to the Buddha, and say this:
‘Sir, this is improper and not proper.

original: Yāyaṁ, bhante, disā abhayā anītikā anupaddavā sāyaṁ disā sabhayā saītikā saupaddavā;
analyzed: yāya bhante disā abhayā anītikā anupaddavā sāyam disā sa bhayā sa ītikā sa upaddavā
translated: Where there was no wind, there is now wind.

original: yato nivātaṁ tato savātaṁ;🔽udakaṁ maññe ādittaṁ;
analyzed: yatas nivātam tatas  udakam maññe āditta
translated: It’s as if the water is on fire.

original: ayyena me dabbena mallaputtena pajāpati dūsitā’”ti.
analyzed: ayyena me dabbena malla puttena pajāpati dūsitā ati
translated: Dabba the Mallian has raped my wife.’”🔽“Yes, Venerables,” Vaḍḍha replied. He then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “Evaṁ, ayyā”ti kho vaḍḍho licchavī mettiyabhūmajakānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vaḍḍho licchavī bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: eva ayya iti kho vaḍḍhaḥ licchavī mettiya bhūmajakānam bhikkhūnam paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi  eka mantam nisinnaḥ khalu vaḍḍhaḥ licchavī bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and told him all that had happened.
“Venerable Sir, this is not proper.

original: Yāyaṁ, bhante, disā abhayā anītikā anupaddavā sāyaṁ disā sabhayā saītikā saupaddavā;
analyzed: yāya bhante disā abhayā anītikā anupaddavā sāyam disā sa bhayā sa ītikā sa upaddavā
translated: The direction that was safe, without tigers or hyenas, has become dangerous, with tigers and hyenas.🔽Where there was no wind, there is now wind.

original: yato nivātaṁ tato savātaṁ;🔽udakaṁ maññe ādittaṁ;
analyzed: yatas nivātam tatas  udakam maññe āditta
translated: It’s as if the water is on fire.

original: ayyena me dabbena mallaputtena pajāpati dūsitā”ti.
analyzed: ayyena me dabbena malla puttena pajāpati dūsitā ati
translated: Dabba the Mallian has raped my wife.”

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṁ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṁ dabbaṁ mallaputtaṁ paṭipucchi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātāpetvā āyasmantam dabbam malla puttam paṭipucchi
translated: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Dabba:

original: “sarasi tvaṁ, dabba, evarūpaṁ kattā yathāyaṁ vaḍḍho āhā”ti?
analyzed: sarasi tva dabbaḥ evarūpam kattā yathā ayam vaḍḍhaḥ āha ati
translated: “Dabba, do you remember doing such and such?”

analyzed: yathā ma bhante bhagavā jānāti iti
translated: “I remember, Sir.”

original: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā …pe…🔽tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ dabbaṁ mallaputtaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho bhagavā pe  tatiyam pi khalu bhagavān āyasmantam dabbam malla puttam etat avoca
translated: A second time …

original: “sarasi tvaṁ, dabba, evarūpaṁ kattā yathāyaṁ vaḍḍho āhā”ti?🔽“Yathā maṁ, bhante, bhagavā jānātī”ti.
analyzed: sarasi tva dabbaḥ evarūpam kattā yathā ayam vaḍḍhaḥ āha ati  yathā ma bhante bhagavā jānāti iti
translated: A third time the Buddha asked Dabba the same question, and he gave the same reply.

analyzed: na kho dabba dabbāḥ evam nibbeṭhenti
translated: “Dabba, you don’t get off that easily.
If you did it, say so.
If you didn’t, say that.”

original: “Yato ahaṁ, bhante, jāto nābhijānāmi supinantenapi methunaṁ dhammaṁ paṭisevitā, pageva jāgaro”ti.
analyzed: yatas aha bhante jātaḥ na abhijānāmi supinantena api methunam dhammam paṭisevitā pagā iva jāgaroti
translated: “Sir, since I was born I don’t recall ever having had sexual intercourse, even in a dream, let alone when I was awake.”
The Buddha then said to the monks:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaṁ nikkujjatu, asambhogaṁ saṅghena karotu.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattam nikkujjatu a sambhogam saṅghena karotu
translated: “Well then, the Sangha should overturn the bowl on Vaḍḍha, and he should not be associated with.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa patto nikkujjitabbo—
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa pattaḥ nikkujjitabbaḥ
translated: The bowl should be overturned on a lay follower who has eight qualities:

original: bhikkhūnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, bhikkhūnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, bhikkhūnaṁ avāsāya
analyzed: bhikkhūnam alābhāya parisakkati bhikkhūnam anatthāya parisakkati bhikkhūnam a vāsāya
translated: he tries to stop people from acquiring material gains; he tries to harm people; he tries to get people to lose their place of residence;

original: parisakkati, bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati, bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti, buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ
analyzed: parisakkati bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti buddhassa avaṇṇa
translated: he abuses and reviles people; he causes division between people; he disparages the Buddha;

original: bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati.
analyzed: bhāsati dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa pattaṁ nikkujjituṁ.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa pattam nikkujjitu
translated: The bowl should be overturned on a lay follower who has these eight qualities.
And it should be overturned like this.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—🔽‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ  suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: A competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:

original: Vaḍḍho licchavī āyasmantaṁ dabbaṁ mallaputtaṁ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṁseti.
analyzed: vaḍḍhaḥ licchavī āyasmantam dabbam malla puttam amūlikāya sīla vipattiyā anuddhaseti
translated: ‘Venerables, the lay follower Vaḍḍha is trying to get Venerable Dabba to commit an offense entailing expulsion.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaṁ nikkujjeyya, asambhogaṁ saṅghena kareyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa patta kalla saṅghaḥ vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattam nikkujjeyya a sambhogam saṅghena kareyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should overturn the bowl on Vaḍḍha the Licchavī, prohibiting him from interacting with the Sangha.
This is the motion.
Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Vaḍḍho licchavī āyasmantaṁ dabbaṁ mallaputtaṁ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṁseti.🔽Saṅgho vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaṁ nikkujjati, asambhogaṁ saṅghena karoti.
analyzed: vaḍḍhaḥ licchavī āyasmantam dabbam malla puttam amūlikāya sīla vipattiyā anuddhaseti  saṅghaḥ vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattam nikkujjati a sambhogam saṅghena karoti
translated: Vaḍḍha the Licchavī is groundlessly charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with failure in morality.🔽The Sangha overturns the bowl on Vaḍḍha the Licchavī, prohibiting him from interacting with the Sangha.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattassa nikkujjanā, asambhogaṁ saṅghena karaṇaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattassa a sambhogam saṅghena saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of overturning the bowl on Vaḍḍha the Licchavī, prohibiting him from interacting with the Sangha, should remain silent.
Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Nikkujjito saṅghena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa patto, asambhogo saṅghena.
analyzed: nikkujjitaḥ saṅghena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaḥ a sambhogaḥ saṅghena
translated: The Sangha has overturned the bowl on Vaḍḍha the Licchavī, prohibiting him from interacting with the Sangha.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā vaḍḍhaṁ licchaviṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai ānandaḥ pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā vaḍḍham licchavim etat avoca
translated: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, Venerable Ānanda took his bowl and robe and went to Vaḍḍha. He said to him,

analyzed: saṅghena te āvuso vaḍḍha pattaḥ nikkujjitaḥ
translated: “Vaḍḍha, the Sangha has overturned your bowl.
You’re excluded from the Sangha.”
Vaḍḍha thought,

original: saṅghena kira me patto nikkujjito, asambhogomhi kira saṅghenāti—
analyzed: saṅghena kira me pattaḥ nikkujjitaḥ a sambhogaḥ mhi kira saṅghena ati
translated: “They say the Sangha has overturned my bowl and that I’m excluded from the Sangha.”
And right there he fainted.

original: Atha kho vaḍḍhassa licchavissa mittāmaccā ñātisālohitā vaḍḍhaṁ licchaviṁ etadavocuṁ—
analyzed: atha kho vaḍḍhassa licchavissa mittāmaccāḥ ñāti sālohitāḥ vaḍḍham licchavim etat avocuḥ
translated: His friends and relatives then said to him,

original: “alaṁ, āvuso vaḍḍha, mā soci, mā paridevi.
analyzed: ala āvuso vaḍḍha mā soci mā paridevi
translated: “Don’t worry, Vaḍḍha, don’t be upset.

analyzed: mayam bhagavantam pasādessāma bhikkhu saṅgham ca ati
translated: We’ll win over the Buddha and the Sangha of monks.”

original: Atha kho vaḍḍho licchavī saputtadāro samittāmacco sañātisālohito allavattho allakeso
analyzed: atha kho vaḍḍhaḥ licchavī sa putta dāraḥ samittāmaccaḥ sañāti sālohitaḥ allavatthaḥ allakeso
translated: Vaḍḍha, his wife, his children, his friends and relatives, and his companions then went to the Buddha,

original: yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He went up to the Buddha, bowed, and said,

original: “accayo maṁ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṁ yathāmūḷhaṁ yathāakusalaṁ, yohaṁ ayyaṁ dabbaṁ mallaputtaṁ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṁsesiṁ.
analyzed: accayaḥ ma bhante accagamāḥ yathābālam yathāmūḍham yathā akusala ayyam dabbam malla puttam amūlikāya sīla vipattiyā anuddhasesi
translated: “Venerable Sir, I’ve made a mistake. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of me to groundlessly charge Dabba the Mallian with failure in morality.

original: Tassa me, bhante, bhagavā accayaṁ accayato paṭiggaṇhātu āyatiṁ saṁvarāyā”ti.
analyzed: tassa me bhante bhagavā accayam accayataḥ paṭiggaṇhātu āyatim savarāya ati
translated: Please accept my confession of this mistake so that I may restrain myself in the future.”

original: “Taggha tvaṁ, āvuso vaḍḍha, accayo accagamā yathābālaṁ yathāmūḷhaṁ yathāakusalaṁ, yaṁ tvaṁ dabbaṁ mallaputtaṁ amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā anuddhaṁsesi.
analyzed: taggha tvam āvuso vaḍḍha accayaḥ accagamāḥ yathābālam yathāmūḍham yathā akusala yam tvam dabbam malla puttam amūlikāya sīla vipattiyā anuddhasesi
translated: “Yes, indeed, you’ve made a mistake. It was foolish, stupid, and unskillful of you to groundlessly charge Dabba the Mallian with failure in morality.

original: Yato ca kho tvaṁ, āvuso vaḍḍha, accayaṁ accayato disvā yathādhammaṁ paṭikarosi, taṁ te mayaṁ paṭiggaṇhāma.
analyzed: yatas ca kho tvam āvuso vaḍḍha accayam accayataḥ disvā yathādhammam paṭikarosi tam te mayam paṭiggaṇhāma
translated: But since you now see your mistake and make proper amends, we accept your confession.

original: Vuḍḍhihesā, āvuso vaḍḍha, ariyassa vinaye yo accayaṁ accayato disvā yathādhammaṁ paṭikaroti, āyatiṁ saṁvaraṁ āpajjatī”ti.
analyzed: āvuso vaḍḍha ariyassa vinaye yaḥ accayam accayataḥ disvā yathādhammam paṭikaroti āyatim savaram āpajjati iti
translated: For it’s growth in the training of the Noble One to see one’s mistake, make proper amends, and undertake restraint for the future.”
The Buddha said this:

original: “tena hi, bhikkhave, saṅgho vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaṁ ukkujjatu, sambhogaṁ saṅghena karotu.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave saṅghaḥ vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattam ukkujjatu sambhogam saṅghena karotu
translated: “Well then, monks, the Sangha should raise the bowl of the Licchavī Vaḍḍha. He should be allowed to share in the Sangha’s affairs.

original: Aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa patto ukkujjitabbo—🔽na bhikkhūnaṁ alābhāya parisakkati, na bhikkhūnaṁ anatthāya parisakkati, na bhikkhūnaṁ
analyzed: aṭṭhahi bhikkhave aṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa pattaḥ ukkujjitabbaḥ  na bhikkhūnam alābhāya parisakkati na bhikkhūnam anatthāya parisakkati
translated: A lay follower who has eight qualities should have his bowl raised:

original: avāsāya parisakkati, na bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati, na bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti,
analyzed: a vāsāya parisakkati na bhikkhū akkosati paribhāsati na bhikkhū bhikkhūhi bhedeti
translated: he doesn’t try to stop the monks from acquiring material gains; he doesn’t try to harm the monks; he doesn’t try to get the monks to stop giving teachings; he doesn’t abuse or insult the monks; he doesn’t cause division between the monks;

original: na buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, na dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, na saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati.
analyzed: na buddhassa avaṇṇam bhāsati na dhammassa avaṇṇam bhāsati na saṅghassa avaṇṇam bhāsati
translated: he doesn’t disparage the Buddha; he doesn’t disparage the Teaching; he doesn’t disparage the Sangha.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa pattaṁ ukkujjituṁ.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave imehi aṭṭhahaṅgehi samannāgatassa upāsakassa pattam ukkujjitu
translated: A lay follower who has these eight qualities should have his bowl raised.
And this is how it should be done.🔽The Sangha should first be informed by an experienced and competent monk, saying:

original: Tena, bhikkhave, vaḍḍhena licchavinā saṅghaṁ upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā bhikkhūnaṁ pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikaṁ nisīditvā añjaliṁ paggahetvā evamassa vacanīyo—
analyzed: tena bhikkhave vaḍḍhena licchavinā saṅgham upasaṅkamitvā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā bhikkhūnam pāde vanditvā ukkuṭikam nisīditvā añjalim paggahetvā evam assa vacanīyaḥ
translated: Vaḍḍha should then approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:

original: ‘saṅghena me, bhante, patto nikkujjito, asambhogomhi saṅghena.
analyzed: saṅghena me bhante pattaḥ nikkujjitaḥ a sambhogaḥ asambhogaḥ asmi saṅghena
translated: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has overturned my bowl. I’m not associating with the Sangha.

original: Sohaṁ, bhante, sammā vattāmi, lomaṁ pātemi, netthāraṁ vattāmi, saṅghaṁ pattukkujjanaṁ yācāmī’ti.🔽Dutiyampi yācitabbo.
analyzed: sā uha bhante sammā vattāmi lomam pātemi netthāram vattāmi saṅgham pattukkujjanam yācāmi iti  dutiyam pi yācitabbo
translated: I’m conducting myself properly and suitably, and deserve to be released. I ask the Sangha to turn my bowl upright.’
He should ask a second and a third time.

original: Byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅgho ñāpetabbo—🔽‘Suṇātu me, bhante, saṅgho.
analyzed: byattena bhikkhunā paṭibalena saṅghaḥ ñāpetabbaḥ  suṇātu me bhante saṅghaḥ
translated: An experienced and competent monk should then inform the Sangha:

original: Saṅghena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa patto nikkujjito, asambhogo saṅghena.
analyzed: saṅghena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaḥ nikkujjitaḥ a sambhogaḥ saṅghena
translated: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has overturned the bowl of Vaḍḍha the Licchavī because he’s not associating with the Sangha.

original: So sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, saṅghaṁ pattukkujjanaṁ yācati.
analyzed: saḥ sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati saṅgham pattukkujjanam yācati
translated: He’s now conducting himself properly and suitably, and deserves to be released. He’s asking the Sangha to turn his bowl upright.

original: Yadi saṅghassa pattakallaṁ, saṅgho vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaṁ ukkujjeyya, sambhogaṁ saṅghena kareyya.
analyzed: yadi saṅghassa patta kalla saṅghaḥ vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattam ukkujjeyya sambhogam saṅghena kareyya
translated: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the bowl of Vaḍḍha the Licchavī and allow him to share the Sangha’s communion.
This is the motion.
Venerables, let the Sangha listen to me.

original: Saṅghena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa patto nikkujjito, asambhogo saṅghena.
analyzed: saṅghena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaḥ nikkujjitaḥ a sambhogaḥ saṅghena
translated: The Sangha has overturned the bowl on Vaḍḍha the Licchavī, not allowing him to share the Sangha’s communion.

original: So sammā vattati, lomaṁ pāteti, netthāraṁ vattati, saṅghaṁ pattukkujjanaṁ yācati.🔽Saṅgho vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaṁ ukkujjati, sambhogaṁ saṅghena karoti.
analyzed: saḥ sammā vattati lomam pāteti netthāram vattati saṅgham pattukkujjanam yācati  saṅghaḥ vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattam ukkujjati sambhogam saṅghena karoti
translated: He’s conducting himself properly and suitably, deserves to be released, and is asking for the Sangha to overturn his bowl and allow him to share the Sangha’s communion.🔽The Sangha overturns the bowl on Vaḍḍha the Licchavī and allows him to share the Sangha’s communion.

original: Yassāyasmato khamati vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattassa ukkujjanā, sambhogaṁ saṅghena karaṇaṁ, so tuṇhassa;
analyzed: yassa ayasmataḥ khamati vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattassa sambhogam saṅghena saḥ tuṇhassa
translated: Any monk who approves of overturning the bowl on Vaḍḍha the Licchavī and allowing him to share the Sangha’s communion should remain silent.
Any monk who doesn’t approve should speak up.

original: Ukkujjito saṅghena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa patto, sambhogo saṅghena.
analyzed: ukkujjitaḥ saṅghena vaḍḍhassa licchavissa pattaḥ sambhogaḥ saṅghena
translated: The Sangha has overturned the bowl on Vaḍḍha the Licchavī and allows him to share the Sangha’s communion.

original: Khamati saṅghassa, tasmā tuṇhī, evametaṁ dhārayāmī’”ti.
analyzed: khamati saṅghassa tasmai tuṇhī evam etam dhārayāmi iti
translated: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”

original: Atha kho bhagavā vesāliyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena bhaggā tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā vesāliyam yathābhirantam viharitvā yena bhaggā tena cārikam pakkāmi
translated: After staying at Vesālī for as long as he liked, the Buddha set out wandering toward Bhaggā.

original: Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena bhaggā tadavasari.
analyzed: anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena bhaggā tat avasari
translated: Wandering by stages, he arrived at Bhaggā,

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāragire bhesakaḷāvane migadāye.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā bhaggesu viharati susumāra gire bhesakaḷā vane migadāye
translated: where he stayed in the Bhesakaḷā Grove, the Deer Park.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bodhissa rājakumārassa kokanado nāma pāsādo acirakārito hoti, anajjhāvuttho samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenaci vā manussabhūtena.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena bodhissa rāja kumārassa kokanadaḥ nāma pāsādaḥ acirakāritaḥ hoti an ajjhāvutthaḥ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenacid vā manussa bhūtena
translated: At that time, Prince Bodhi had recently built a palace called Kokanada, which had not yet been inhabited by any contemplative, brahmin, or anyone at all in human form.

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro sañcikāputtaṁ māṇavaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ sañcikāputtam māṇavam āmantesi
translated: Prince Bodhi addressed the student Sañcikāputta,

original: “ehi tvaṁ, samma sañcikāputta, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda;
analyzed: ehi tva samma sañcikāputta yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavataḥ pāde sirasā vanda
translated: “Come, my dear Sañcikāputta, go to the Blessed One and, on arrival, showing reverence with your head to his feet in my name, ask whether he is free from illness & affliction, is carefree, strong, & living in comfort, saying:🔽‘Prince Bodhi, lord, shows reverence with his head to your feet.

original: appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ puccha—
analyzed: appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram puccha
translated: He asks whether you are free from illness & affliction, are carefree, strong, & living in comfort,

original: ‘bodhi, bhante, rājakumāro bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchatī’ti.
analyzed: bodhi bhante rāja kumāraḥ bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati iti
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, Prince Bodhi bows his head at your feet. He asks after your wellbeing, health, strength, and comfort.’
And say this:

original: ‘adhivāsetu kira, bhante, bhagavā bodhissa rājakumārassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā’”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhante bhagavā bodhissa rāja kumārassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: ‘Venerable Sir, please accept tomorrow’s meal from Prince Bodhi together with the Sangha of monks.’”

original: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho sañcikāputto māṇavo bodhissa rājakumārassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā🔽tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ
analyzed: eva bhoti kho sañcikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bodhissa rāja kumārassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā  tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīya
translated: “Yes, sir,” replied Sañcikāputta. He then went to the Buddha,🔽exchanged pleasantries with him,
and sat down.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho sañcikāputto māṇavo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu sañcikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: He then said,

original: “bodhi kho rājakumāro bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati.
analyzed: bodhi kho rāja kumāraḥ bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati
translated: ‘Prince Bodhi bows his head at your feet. He asks after your wellbeing, health, strength, and comfort.
And he says this:

original: ‘adhivāsetu kira bhavaṁ gotamo bodhissa rājakumārassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā’”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu kira bhavam gotamaḥ bodhissa rāja kumārassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: ‘Will the honorable Gotama please accept tomorrow’s meal from Prince Bodhi together with the Sangha of monks.’”
The Buddha consented by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho sañcikāputto māṇavo bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena bodhi rājakumāro tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bodhiṁ rājakumāraṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha kho sañcikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā yena bodhi rāja kumāraḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bodhim rāja kumāram etat avoca
translated: The brahmin student Sañcikāputta, knowing that the Buddha had consented, got up from his seat, went to Prince Bodhi, and told him what had happened.

original: “avocumha kho mayaṁ bhoto vacanena taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ—
analyzed: avocumha khalu mayam bhotaḥ vacanena tam bhavantam gotama
translated: “We spoke to the Buddha, saying,

original: ‘bodhi kho rājakumāro bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati.
analyzed: bodhi kho rāja kumāraḥ bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati
translated: ‘Prince Bodhi bows down at the feet of the Buddha with his head. He asks about your health, whether you’re comfortable, strong, and free from illness.

original: Evañca vadeti—🔽adhivāsetu kira bhavaṁ gotamo bodhissa rājakumārassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā’ti.
analyzed: evañca vada iti  adhivāsetu kira bhavam gotamaḥ bodhissa rāja kumārassa svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: He says this:🔽“Will the Buddha please accept tomorrow’s meal from Prince Bodhi together with the Sangha of monks?”

analyzed: adhivuttham ca pana samaṇena gotamena ati
translated: The Buddha has consented.’”

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro tassā rattiyā accayena paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā,
analyzed: atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā
translated: The next morning, when it was time for the midday meal, Prince Bodhi had various kinds of fine food prepared.

original: kokanadañca pāsādaṁ odātehi dussehi santharāpetvā yāva pacchimasopānakaḷevarā, sañcikāputtaṁ māṇavaṁ āmantesi—
analyzed: kokanadam ca pāsādam odātehi dussehi santharāpetvā yāva pacchima sopāna kaḷevarā sañcikāputtam māṇavam āmantesi
translated: He had the Kokanada stilt house covered with white cloth, right down to the last step of the staircase,

original: “ehi tvaṁ, samma sañcikāputta, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocehi—🔽‘kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan’”ti.🔽“Evaṁ, bho”ti kho sañcikāputto māṇavo bodhissa rājakumārassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocesi—
analyzed: ehi tva samma sañcikāputta yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkama upasaṅkamitvā bhagavataḥ kālam ārocehi  kālaḥ bhante niṭṭhitam bhattanti  eva bhoti kho sañcikāputtaḥ māṇavaḥ bodhissa rāja kumārassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavataḥ kālam ārocesi
translated: and he told the brahmin student Sañcikāputta,🔽“Go to the Buddha and tell him that the meal is ready.”
“Yes, sir,” he replied, and he did as asked.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena bodhissa rājakumārassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena bodhissa rāja kumārassa nivesanam tena upasaṅkami
translated: The Buddha then robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Prince Bodhi’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Tena kho pana samayena bodhi rājakumāro bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhito hoti, bhagavantaṁ āgamayamāno.
analyzed: tena khalu pana samayena bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bahidvāra koṭṭhake ṭhitaḥ hoti bhagavantam āgamayamānaḥ
translated: At that time Prince Bodhi was standing outside the gatehouse, waiting for the Buddha.

original: Addasā kho bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
analyzed: addasā khalu bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam dūratas uva āgacchanta
translated: He saw the Buddha coming and went out to meet him.

original: Disvāna tato paccuggantvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā purekkhatvā yena kokanado pāsādo tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: disvāna tatas paccuggantvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā purekkhatvā yena kokanadaḥ pāsādo tena upasaṅkami
translated: He bowed down to the Buddha and then walked in front of him to the Kokanada stilt house.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pacchimasopānakaḷevaraṁ nissāya aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pacchima sopānaka ḷevaram nissāya aṭṭhāsi
translated: The Buddha stood at the bottom of the last step.

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Prince Bodhi said to him,

original: “akkamatu, bhante, bhagavā dussāni, akkamatu sugato dussāni, yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
analyzed: akkamatu bhante bhagavā dussāni akkamatu sugataḥ dussāni yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: “Sir, please step on the cloths so that it may lead to my benefit and happiness for a long time.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi.🔽Dutiyampi kho …pe…
analyzed: evam vutte bhagavā tuṇhī ahosi  dutiyam pi kho pe
translated: But the Buddha remained silent.

original: tatiyampi kho bodhi rājakumāro bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: tatiyam pi khalu bodhi rāja kumāraḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Prince Bodhi said the same thing a second and a third time,

original: “akkamatu, bhante, bhagavā dussāni, akkamatu sugato dussāni, yaṁ mama assa dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
analyzed: akkamatu bhante bhagavā dussāni akkamatu sugataḥ dussāni yam mama assa dīgharattam hitāya sukhāya ati
translated: and the Buddha remained silent.

original: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ apalokesi.
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyasmantam ānandam apalokesi
translated: The Buddha looked at Ānanda,

original: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bodhiṁ rājakumāraṁ etadavoca—
analyzed: atha khalu āyasmai ānandaḥ bodhim rāja kumāram etat avoca
translated: and Ānanda said to Prince Bodhi,
“Please take down the cloth coverings, prince.

original: Na bhagavā celapaṭikaṁ akkamissati pacchimaṁ janataṁ tathāgato anukampatī”ti.
analyzed: na bhagavā cela paṭikam akkamissati pacchimam janatam tathāgataḥ anukampati iti
translated: The Buddha won’t step on them. The Buddha has compassion for future generations.”

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro dussāni saṁharāpetvā uparikokanade pāsāde āsanaṁ paññapesi.
analyzed: atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ dussāni saharāpetvā upari kokanade pāsāde āsanam paññapesi
translated: Prince Bodhi then had the cloth coverings taken down and prepared a seat in the Kokanada stilt house.

original: Atha kho bhagavā kokanadaṁ pāsādaṁ abhiruhitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā kokanadam pāsādam abhiruhitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: The Buddha then ascended the Kokanada stilt house and sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Atha kho bodhi rājakumāro buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena🔽sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā, bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ, ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bodhi rāja kumāraḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena 🔽sahatthā santappetvā sampavāretvā bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇi ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Prince Bodhi personally served various kinds of fine food to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.🔽When the Buddha had finished his meal, Prince Bodhi sat down to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho bodhiṁ rājakumāraṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnam kho bodhim rāja kumāram bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahasetvā uṭṭhāya āsanā pakkāmi
translated: When he had done so, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

original: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṁ nidāne etasmiṁ pakaraṇe dhammiṁ kathaṁ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā etasmim nidāne etasmim pakaraṇe dhammim katham katvā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
“You should not step on a piece of cloth.
If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī apagatagabbhā bhikkhū nimantetvā dussaṁ paññapetvā etadavoca—
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena aññatarā itthī apagata gabbhā bhikkhū nimantetvā dussam paññapetvā etat avoca
translated: On one occasion a woman who had recently given birth invited some monks, offered them cloth,
and said, “Venerables, step on the cloth.”
Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not step on it.

analyzed: akkamatha bhante dussam maṅgala tthāya ati
translated: “Venerables, step on the cloth for the sake of good luck.”
Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks still did not step on it.

original: Atha kho sā itthī ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
analyzed: atha kho sā itthī ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti
translated: That woman then complained and criticized them,

original: “kathañhi nāma ayyā maṅgalatthāya yāciyamānā celapaṭikaṁ na akkamissantī”ti.
analyzed: katham hi nāma ayyā maṅgala atthāya yāciyamānā cela paṭikam na akkamissanti iti
translated: “How can the venerables not step on the cloth when asked to do so for the sake of good luck?”

original: Assosuṁ kho bhikkhū tassā itthiyā ujjhāyantiyā khiyyantiyā vipācentiyā.
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhū tassā itthiyā ujjhāyantiyā khiyyantiyā vipācentiyā
translated: The monks heard the complaints of that woman.

original: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ etam attham ārocesu
translated: They told the Buddha.
“Monks, householders are superstitious.

original: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gihīnaṁ maṅgalatthāya yāciyamānena celapaṭikaṁ akkamitun”ti.
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave gihīnam maṅgala atthāya yāciyamānena cela paṭikam akkamitun ti
translated: If a householder asks you, you should step on the hem of his robe for his protection.”

original: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dhotapādakaṁ akkamituṁ kukkuccāyanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū dhota pādakam akkamitum kukkuccāyanti
translated: At that time the monks were afraid to step on a foot-wiping stone.
They told the Buddha.

analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave dhota pādakam akkamitun ti
translated: “I allow you to step on a foot-wiping stone.”

original: Dutiyabhāṇavāro niṭṭhito.🔽Atha kho bhagavā bhaggesu yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṁ pakkāmi.🔽Anupubbena cārikaṁ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.
analyzed: dutiya bhāṇa vāraḥ niṭṭhito  atha kho bhagavā bhaggesu yathābhirantam viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikam pakkāmi  anupubbena cārikam caramānaḥ yena sāvatthi tat avasari
translated: The second section for recitation is finished.🔽When the Buddha had stayed in the Bhaggas’ country for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

original: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tatra sudam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: When he eventually arrived, he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

original: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā ghaṭakañca katakañca sammajjaniñca ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho visākhā migāramātā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca—
